intro: Thlaspi phrygium, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy. Thlaspi phrygium is often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
